quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Creature and Kind
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, afanc, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What creature from Arthurian legends has a serpents head, a leopards body and deers feet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Questing Beast

questions.question: What was the nickname of Jacopo Robusti (1518-1594), an Italian artist, often compared to Furioso?
The European dragon, which is part of the English mythology, is depicted on the national flag of this country.
What is the Banshee spirit from Irish mythology associated with?
Giovanni Battista Tiepolo, an Italian painter who became most famous in Europe between 1750 and 1770, is a representative of which art movement?
Where does the British mythological creature Afanc live according to legend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In lakes

questions.question: What kind of creature is the Fuath according to Celtic mythology?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Water spirit

questions.question: The paintings of Italian painter Giorgio Morandi, who was born in Bologna in 1890, were featured in which film by Federico Fellini?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: La Dolce Vita

questions.question: The yale, a creature from English and European mythology, resembles this animal.
Which of the following works was painted by Titian, one of the most famous painters of the Renaissance and the Vetian school?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Penitent Mery Magdalen

questions.question: What kind of creature is the Melusine according to European folklore?

options.text: A dog with an eagle head

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A woman with serpent body

questions.question: What animal does the English mythological creature Enfield resemble?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Name the creature from British and European mythology which is shaped like a serpent or dragon and swallows its own tail.
What head does the mythological creature called manticore have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Human head

questions.question: Sfumato, which means blended in Italian is an art technique, created by which Italian Renaissance artist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leonardo da Vinci

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Dance and Country
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, pera, sculpture. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Leonardo da Vinci was hired to paint one of the walls of the Palazzo Vecchio in Florence. Who was his rival that painted the opposite wall?
Which Italian artist made the sculpture Neptune and Triton, displayed in the Victoria and Albert Museum in London?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gian lorenzo Bernini

questions.question: Which is the oldest of the so-called ballroom dances?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Viennese Waltz

questions.question: The movement Pittura Metafisica (metaphysical painting), that presents an alternative and illogical reality, was founded in 1917 by which Italian artists?

options.text: Carlo Carra and Giorgio de Chirico
Amedio Clemente Modigliani and Giorgio de Chirico
Emilio Vedova and Amedio Clemente Modigliani

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carlo Carra and Giorgio de Chirico

questions.question: Cali, Rueda and Casino are different styles of this popular Latin dance.
What is the popular dance style Charleston named after?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A city

questions.question: It is widely believed that the foxtrot dance got its name from which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An actor

questions.question: What dance does Al Pacinos character perform in the 1992 movie Scent of a Woman, when he gets enchanted by the perfume of his dancing partner?
What is the Tagalog word for tree?
Toprock, footwork, power moves, freezes, and suicides are techniques used in this popular dance style.
In what country did the Cha-cha-cha dance originate?
In the 1950s, what name was used for the dance that is nowadays referred to as boogie-woogie?
What does the Tagalog word pera mean in English?
In what country did the Bachata dance originate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dominican Republic

questions.question: In which country did the Mambo music and dance originate in the 1930s?

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Word and Dancing
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, saan, phrase. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What Tagalog word means Monday?
Beautiful is to the Tagalog word maganda, as fat is to this word.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Where do you live?

questions.question: Rembrandt initially achieved success as a painter of what type of paintings?
What does the Tagalog word Sabado mean in English?
One is to the Tagalog word isa as two is to this Tagalog word.
The Tagalog word tama means correct in English.
Does the Tagalog word anim mean six in English?
Is it true that the Tagalog word salamin means pencil in English?
In dancing, the word foutette means to straighten.
A grand jete is a type of leap in dancing.
In dancing, what is Triple Threat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Singing, Dancing and Acting

questions.question: Of what origin was painter and etcher Rembrandt?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jazz and Ballet

questions.question: What personal tragedy did Rembrandt experience after he got married?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Proverb and Rembrandt
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, condition, humanities. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who is the man whose corpse is depicted in Rembrandts famous painting The Anatomy Lesson of Dr. Nicolaes Tulp?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A criminal

questions.question: During what century did painter Rembrandt live and work?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seventeenth century

questions.question: Which of these is true about Rembrandts famous painting The Storm on the Sea of Galilee that was stolen in 1990?

options.text: It is the only marine painting by Rembrandt.
It is Rembrandts only work to feature the image of Jesus.
It is the only painting by Rembrandt to feature religious images.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is the only marine painting by Rembrandt.

questions.question: Why did Rembrandt nearly go bankrupt at a certain point of his life?

options.text: He collected tons of art pieces.
He spent his money on alcohol.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He collected tons of art pieces.

questions.question: What common name was given to Rembrandts famous painting, The Company of Frans Banning Cocq and Willem van Ruytenburch?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Night Watch

questions.question: What is the missing word from the Chinese proverb: If the wind comes from an empty ..., its not without a reason?
What did Rembrandt seek to achieve in his art according to a statement he made in a letter?

options.text: the greatest and most natural movement
to provoke the beholder to create a story in his own head
to keep the eye of the beholder on the painting
the best possible combination of light, shadow and color

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the greatest and most natural movement

questions.question: What is the missing verb from the Chinese proverb originating from the works of Chinese philosopher Confucius, I hear and I ...; I see and I remember; I do and I understand?
Rembrandt is believed to have suffered from this medical condition.
Complete the Chinese proverb, If you have money you can make ... push your grind stone.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the devil

questions.question: Complete the Chinese proverb, ‘… must be chiseled before it can be considered a gem’.
What is the missing word from the following Chinese proverb: To hit a ... with a meat-bun?
The name of what animal is missing in the Chinese proverb, A ... father has no canine sons?
What word is missing from the Chinese proverb: A ... can start a fire that burns the entire prairie?
What is the meaning of the Chinese proverb, Riding a mule while looking for a horse?

options.text: Keeping what you have but looking for better options
Looking for something that you already have
Looking for trouble, not being satisfied with what you have
Taking what you have for granted

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Keeping what you have but looking for better options

In what language is this line:

options.text: Small things can lead to big results.
You should respond to small favor with a larger one.
A small investment will pay back generously.
Seemingly insignificant things can grow with time.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: You should respond to small favor with a larger one.

options.text: saying that I look good today, are you inferring that I did not look good yesterday?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sweden and Finland
